pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:0.5: 87. The training rule on beds and benches
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.2: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan was sleeping on a high bed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.3: On one occasion, as the Buddha and a number of monks were walking about the dwellings, they came to Upananda’s dwelling.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.6: “Sir, please come and see my bed.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.7: The Buddha turned around on the spot and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.8: “A fool, monks, can be recognized by his sleeping place.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.9: After rebuking Upananda in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support … the Buddha said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.10: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:1.11.1: ‘If a monk is having a new bed or bench made, it is to have legs eight standard fingerbreadths long below the lowest frame. If the legs exceed that, they are to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.2: newly made is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.4: there are four kinds of beds: one with legs and frame, called masāraka; one with legs and frame, called bundikābaddha; one with crooked legs; one with detachable legs.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.6: there are four kinds of benches: one with legs and frame, called masāraka; one with legs and frame, called bundikābaddha; one with crooked legs; one with detachable legs.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.8: making it himself or having it made.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.9: It is to have legs eight standard fingerbreadths long below the lowest frame:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.11: If he makes one, or has one made, that exceeds that, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct. When he gets it, the legs are to be cut down, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.12.1: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.13: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.14: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.15: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.16: If he makes one or has one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.1.17: If he gets one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.2: if he makes it the right size;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.3: if he makes it smaller than the right size;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.4: if he gets one made by another that exceeds the right size and then cuts the legs down before using it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.6: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc87:2.2.7: The training rule on beds and benches, the fifth, is finished.
